result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Brownell, Daniel James

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on March 1, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

3:31 PM Defendant Daniel James Brownell appeared by video, in custody. Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Daniel James Brownell.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. State believes it will be a waiver. Attorney Halyburton agrees and explains she does not have a waiver filed out but has went over the form with him verbally. Court goes over preliminary hearing questionnaire waiver, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Attorney has received a copy of information, waives further reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and will have set for PTC with DA and PLEAS and continues bond. Court instructs defendant that he must appear in person for those proceedings. Halyburton asks for 21CF60 to be set for the same dates as set in this case. Court allows. If still in custody, let his attorney know to be transported to court.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2023 at 10:45 am.

9:16 AM Defendant Daniel James Brownell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appeared by video for Daniel James Brownell.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Halyburton has went over the complaint, waives further reading, will be asking for PH, within time limits and would like to address. bond. Halyburton asks for signature bond or low cash bond $250. State objects and asks for bond to remain. Court questions Brownell on address and what is holding him back from obtaining a drivers license. State recites criminal history. Court reduces bond to $250 cash bond
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
